intro: Tetranthera glauca var. elongata, commonly known as the elongated tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, often with a striking blue or purple coloration. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
